isis.stitle: New Vehicle Loss and Damage Procedures Manual - Concealed Damage

svcproc.title: Concealed Damage
svcproc.para: DAMAGE THAT CANNOT BE SEEN DURING A NORMAL INSPECTION is considered "concealed". Typical locations are the oil pan, inside the sidewalls of tires, the bottom side of fuel/air tank, etc.

REMEMBER, ON A CONCEALED DAMAGE CLAIMS, THE BURDEN OF PROOF LIES WITH THE CLAIMANT, NOT THE CARRIER.
Please refer to the New Vehicle Processing Manual, CTS-1029, and the Warranty Procedures and Administrative Policies Manual, CTS-1100.
When concealed damage is found after initial inspection, ATC must be notified using one of the three methods listed below.

step1.para: NOTIFY THE CARRIER WITHIN 48 HOURS OF DELIVERY TIME, by calling the ATC Leasing Claims Department, toll-free at 1-800-451-7560 during regular business hours, 7:30am-4:30pm Central Time, Monday through Friday. (i.e. Vehicle delivered Friday at 3:00, dealer has until Tuesday at 4:30 to notify carrier of concealed damage.)
NOTIFY THE CARRIER WITHIN 48 HOURS OF DELIVERY TIME, via fax, at 262-605-6073.
NOTIFY THE CARRIER WITHIN 48 HOURS OF DELIVERY TIME, by letter via certified mail at:

svcproc.para: When notifying the carrier of damages or shortages, be prepared to supply the following information:

item.para: Explanation as to why the damage was not detected at time of delivery.

para.emph: PLEASE NOTE: NOTIFYING THE CARRIER OF DAMAGES OR SHORTAGES OF A CONCEALED NATURE DOES NOT INSURE THE PAYMENT OF THE CLAIM. THE CLAIM MAY STILL BE DENIED BY THE CARRIER OR THE INTERNATIONAL WARRANTY CENTER PENDING FURTHER REVIEW. IN THE EVENT A CLAIM IS DENIED, YOU SHOULD CONTACT THE CARRIER DIRECTLY INSTEAD OF FILING AN APPEALS CLAIM OR CONTACTING INTERNATIONAL WARRANTY.
